content.description: A recent report indicated that 90 percent of adults in a certain region actively try to include vegetables in their diet. A simulation was conducted that consisted of 50 trials with a population parameter of 0.9. Each trial consisted of a sample size of 10. The number of successes out of 10 was recorded, where success represented an adult trying to include vegetables in the diet.
content.question: Five possible simulation results are shown. Which simulation is the best match to the one described?

choices.label: The figure presents a dotplot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 10. The data from the dot plot are as follows. 0 through 6, no data recorded; 7, 1 dot; 8, 2 dots; 9, 4 dots; 10, 1 dot.

The figure presents a dotplot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 10. The data from the dot plot are as follows. 0 through 2, no data recorded; 3, 1 dot; 4, 2 dots; 5, 4 dots; 6, 2 dots; 7, 1 dot; 8 through 10, no data recorded.

The figure presents a dotplot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 100, in increments of 10. The data from the dot plot are as follows. 0 through 20, no data recorded; 30, 1 dot; 40, 2 dot; 50, 4 dots; 60, 2 dots; 70, 1 dots; 80 through 100, no data recorded.

The figure presents a dotplot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 100, in increments of 10. The data from the dot plot are as follows. 0 through 60, no data recorded; 70, 3 dots; 80, 10 dots; 90, 20 dots; 100, 17 dots.

The figure presents a dotplot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 10. The data from the dot plot are as follows. 0 through 6, no data recorded; 7, 3 dots; 8, 10 dots; 9, 20 dots; 10, 17 dots.

content.answer: The figure presents a dotplot with tick marks labeled with the numbers 0 through 10. The data from the dot plot are as follows. 0 through 6, no data recorded; 7, 3 dots; 8, 10 dots; 9, 20 dots; 10, 17 dots.
